sentences.sContent: The family never quite regained its former influence.
sentences.sCn: 这个家族再也没有恢复往昔的影响力。

sentences.sContent: He somehow managed to regain his balance .
Government forces have regained control of the city.
sentences.sCn: 政府军已重新控制了这座城市。

sentences.sContent: When she regained consciousness (= woke up after being unconscious ) , she was lying on the floor.
sentences.sCn: 她恢复知觉醒来时，正躺在地板上。

sentences.sContent: He looked stunned, but he soon regain ed his composure (= became calm again ) .
sentences.sCn: 他似乎愣了愣，但很快就恢复平静了。

sentences.sContent: The doctors don’t know if he will ever regain the use of his legs.
sentences.sCn: 医生们不知道他的腿是否还能恢复功能。

trans.tranOther: to get something back, especially an ability or quality, that you have lost
